modules.description: Processes lexical analysis with custom rules, supports character set manipulation and token recognition. Operates on strings and input channels, enabling pattern matching against text streams. Used for parsing domain-specific languages and extracting structured data from unformatted text.

Provides functions to process and manipulate UTF-8 encoded strings, including calculating code point widths, advancing through encoded characters, converting between strings and integer arrays, and handling streaming input. Operates on strings, integer arrays, and character streams. Used to decode UTF-8 data from files, process incoming network data, and generate encoded output for storage or transmission.

The module offers low-level lexical analysis operations, including buffer creation, position tracking, and character extraction for streams, arrays, and channels with support for Latin-1, UTF-8, and variable encodings. It enables manipulation of input buffers with features like backtracking and encoded lexeme retrieval, working directly with `lexbuf` structures to manage text processing tasks. This is particularly useful for parsing applications requiring precise control over input handling and encoding-specific operations.
